alert.note: Alert for Southern Middlesex; Southern New London (Connecticut) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS New York City - Upton (Long Island and New York City)
info.headline: Coastal Flood Advisory issued March 02 at 6:25PM EST until March 04 at 10:00AM EST by NWS New York City - Upton
info.description: ...COASTAL FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 5 AM TO 10 AM EST SATURDAY... * WHAT...Up to 1 1/2 foot of inundation above ground level expected in vulnerable areas near the waterfront and shoreline. * WHERE...Southern Middlesex and Southern New London Counties. * WHEN...From 5 AM to 10 AM EST Saturday. * COASTAL IMPACTS...Minor flooding is expected in the most vulnerable locations near the waterfront and shoreline. Expect up to 1 1/2 feet of inundation above ground level in low lying, vulnerable areas. Some roads and low lying property including parking lots, parks, lawns and homes/businesses with basements near the waterfront will experience shallow flooding. * SHORELINE IMPACTS...Breaking waves of 2 to 4 ft will result in beach erosion, with wave splashover over dunes and bulkheads exacerbating flooding of shoreline roads and properties. Localized minor damage to shoreline structures is possible. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...The magnitude of coastal flooding will be heavily determined by the timing of winds shifting from the east to the northeast in relation to the time of high tide Saturday morning. At this point, this windshift is expected to occur before the time of high tide, but if this windshift is slower, water levels could near moderate flood thresholds in a few spots. Time of high total tides are approximate to the nearest hour. NEW HAVEN HARBOR AT NEW HAVEN CT MLLW CATEGORIES - MINOR 8.7 FT, MODERATE 9.3 FT, MAJOR 10.6 FT MHHW CATEGORIES - MINOR 2.0 FT, MODERATE 2.6 FT, MAJOR 3.9 FT TOTAL TOTAL DEPARTURE DAY/TIME TIDE TIDE FROM NORM WAVES FLOOD FT MLLW FT MHHW FT FT IMPACT -------- --------- --------- --------- ------- -------- 02/08 PM 5.9/ 6.4 -0.9/-0.4 0.6/ 1.1 0-1 NONE 03/09 AM 6.7/ 7.2 0.0/ 0.5 0.9/ 1.4 0 NONE 03/09 PM 7.0/ 7.5 0.2/ 0.8 1.5/ 2.0 1-2 NONE 04/09 AM 9.6/10.1 2.8/ 3.4 3.5/ 4.0 2-4 MODERATE 04/10 PM 7.2/ 7.7 0.5/ 1.0 1.4/ 1.9 1 NONE 05/10 AM 7.5/ 8.0 0.8/ 1.3 1.3/ 1.8 1 NONE THAMES RIVER AT NEW LONDON CT MLLW CATEGORIES - MINOR 5.1 FT, MODERATE 6.1 FT, MAJOR 7.9 FT MHHW CATEGORIES - MINOR 2.0 FT, MODERATE 3.0 FT, MAJOR 4.8 FT TOTAL TOTAL DEPARTURE DAY/TIME TIDE TIDE FROM NORM WAVES FLOOD FT MLLW FT MHHW FT FT IMPACT -------- --------- --------- --------- ------- -------- 02/06 PM 2.7/ 3.2 -0.5/ 0.0 0.7/ 1.1 1 NONE 03/07 AM 3.2/ 3.7 0.2/ 0.7 0.9/ 1.4 1 NONE 03/08 PM 3.5/ 4.0 0.4/ 0.9 1.5/ 2.0 1 NONE 04/08 AM 5.6/ 6.1 2.5/ 3.0 3.1/ 3.6 2-4 MIN-MOD 04/07 PM 3.7/ 4.2 0.6/ 1.1 1.5/ 2.0 2 NONE 05/08 AM 4.0/ 4.5 0.9/ 1.4 1.5/ 2.0 1 NONE &&
info.instruction: If travel is required, allow extra time as some roads may be closed. Do not drive around barricades or through water of unknown depth. Take the necessary actions to protect flood-prone property.
